name: analytics_management_goals_list
description: Lists goals to which the user has access.

accountId.description: Account ID to retrieve goals for. Can either be a specific account ID or '~all', which refers to all the accounts that user has access to.

webPropertyId.description: Web property ID to retrieve goals for. Can either be a specific web property ID or '~all', which refers to all the web properties that user has access to.

profileId.description: View (Profile) ID to retrieve goals for. Can either be a specific view (profile) ID or '~all', which refers to all the views (profiles) that user has access to.

max-results.description: The maximum number of goals to include in this response.

start-index.description: An index of the first goal to retrieve. Use this parameter as a pagination mechanism along with the max-results parameter.

fields.description: Selector specifying which fields to include in a partial response.

key.description: API key. Your API key identifies your project and provides you with API access, quota, and reports. Required unless you provide an OAuth 2.0 token.

oauth_token.description: OAuth 2.0 token for the current user.

prettyPrint.description: Returns response with indentations and line breaks.

quotaUser.description: An opaque string that represents a user for quota purposes. Must not exceed 40 characters.

$block: A goal collection lists Analytics goals to which the user has access. Each view (profile) can have a set of goals. Each resource in the Goal collection corresponds to a single Analytics goal.

$ul: **itemsPerPage**: The maximum number of resources the response can contain, regardless of the actual number of resources returned. Its value ranges from 1 to 1000 with a value of 1000 by default, or otherwise specified by the max-results query parameter.
**nextLink**: Link to next page for this goal collection.
**previousLink**: Link to previous page for this goal collection.
**startIndex**: The starting index of the resources, which is 1 by default or otherwise specified by the start-index query parameter.
**totalResults**: The total number of results for the query, regardless of the number of resources in the result.
**username**: Email ID of the authenticated user
